column2: NEW MEXICO PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column4: New Mexico

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.
column6: remove the sign and move forward.
column10: look for a detour or another route.

column2: 2. If it safe to do so, you can pass a vehicle ahead when:
column4: there is a solid line on your side of the road.
column6: you are on a hill or curve.
column8: there is a broken line on your side of the road.

column2: 3. To pass a bicyclist traveling in the same direction on a two-lane road without bicycle lanes, you should:
column4: not pass the bicyclist until you come to a traffic signal or stop sign.
column6: honk at the bicyclist to let him or her know you are about to pass.
column8: continue driving straight, it is the bicyclist’s responsibility to get out of your way.
column10: slow down and wait until there is no oncoming traffic, then pass the bicyclist leaving him or her  sufficient space.

column2: 4. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column4: only if the traffic signal turns red.
column10: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 5. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Get out of the car and check behind the car.
column6: Look through your back window for children.

column2: 6. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: signal.
column6: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.
column8: look at your interior rear-view mirror.

column2: 7. A solid yellow line on your side of the center line means:
column4: Do not pass

column2: 8. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: go to the next entrance ramp.
column6: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.
column8: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.

column2: 9. When you are driving at night and another vehicle is approaching, you should use your parking lights.
column4: False

column2: 10. If you drink alcohol socially, what helps insure safe driving?
column4: Take a cold shower before driving.
column6: Stop drinking one hour before driving.
column8: Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking.

column2: 11. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column4: low beam headlights.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road

column2: 13. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
column4: A No Passing Zone

column2: 14. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must turn into its right lane.
column6: must go to the next intersection.
column10: must turn into its left lane.

column2: 15. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column4: stay in your lane, slow down, and let it pass.
column6: drive to the right side of the road and stop.
column10: keep moving slowly, staying to the right side of the road.

column2: 16. Look over your shoulder to check your blind spot:
column4: on all right and left turns.
column6: when pulling to the right side of the road or away from a curb.

column2: 17. If weather requires you to have your lights on, you should use your:
column4: emergency flashers.

column2: 18. This sign means drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding.
column8: give the right-of-way to traffic on the road they wish to enter.
column10: proceed at normal speed through the upcoming intersection.

column2: 19. When driving at night, drivers should:
column4: look directly into the oncoming headlights of approaching vehicles.

column2: 20. When you approach a railroad crossing, but you do not see a train. You must stop:
column4: if a crossing gate is lowered.
column6: if a stop sign is posted.
column8: if the crossing lights are flashing.

column2: 21. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column8: slow down and keep well to the right.
column10: slow down and keep well to the left.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column4: Flagger ahead

column2: 23. A traffic light shows both a red light and a green arrow. The driver may not turn in the direction of the arrow until the red light has changed.
column4: False

column2: 24. This sign means:
column4: Detour to the right
column6: Stay on the main highway if possible
column10: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only

column2: 25. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column4: Allow others to merge smoothly.
column6: Look to the left and right for other traffic.
column10: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.
